questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Adenoid facies The condition in the given image is of adenoid facies.

Highyeild:

Features present are Open mouth Elongated face Hitched up upper lip Malocclusion of teeth High arched hard palate Pinched in nose (due to disuse atrophy of ala nasi)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- OPTION B- In Goldenhar syndrome there is Facial asymmetry , Low set ears, atresia of ear canal , Cardiac abnormalities , Preauricular tags/pits , Hemivertebrae in cervical region. OPTION C- Horse face deformity is not seen anywhere. OPTION D- Frog face deformity is seen in juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma.

Extraedge:

Adenoid facies. Chronic nasal obstruction and mouth breathing lead to characteristic facial appearance called adenoid facies. The child has an elongated face with dull expression, open mouth, prominent and crowded upper teeth and hitched up upper lip. Nose gives a pinched-in appearance due to disuse atrophy of alaenasi . Hard palate in these cases is highly arched as the moulding action of the tongue on palate is lost

questions.text: Which is not a major criteria for the diagnosis of allergic fungal sinusitis:

options.label: D
options.text: Allergic mucin discharge showing fungal hyphae

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fungal culture positivity Fungal culture positivity is a minor criteria of allergic fungal rhinosinusitis.

Highyeild:

Diagnostic criteria for allergic fungal rhinosinusitis (Bent and Kuhn) Major criteria Type 1 hypersensitivity Nasal polyposis Characteristic CT findings Eosinophilic mucin Positive fungal stain Minor criteria Asthma Unilateral predominance Radiographic bone erosion Fungal culture Charcot Leyden crystals Serum eosinophilia All the major criteria must be met by the patient while the minor criteria serve to support the diagnosis and describe individual patients .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- OPTION A- Nasal polyposis is a major criteria for diagnosis of allergic fungal sinusitis. OPTION C- Characteristics CT findings without invasion is also a major criteria for diagnosis of allergic fungal sinusitis. OPTION D- Allergic mucin discharge showing fungal hyphae is also a major criteria for diagnosis of allergic fungal sinusitis.

questions.text: A 6 years old child with recurrent attacks of tonsillitis underwent tonsillectomy, his post operative period was uneventful. On next day there he has mild bleeding from oral cavity. Which of the following structure is responsible for it?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Peri tonsillar vein Peri tonsillar vein is the most common source of bleeding after tonsillectomy .

Highyeild:

Bleeding after tonsillectomy Primary hemorrhage Due to injury to the vessel Ligate the vessel Reactionary hemorrhage Within 24 hours Due to slippage of ligature Religate the vessel Secondary hemorrhage Due to infection IV antibiotics are given

Extraedge:

TECHNIQUES OF TONSILLECTOMY/ TONSILLOTOMY Cold methods Dissection and snare (most common) Guillotine method Intracapsular (capsule preserving) tonsillectomy with debrider Harmonic scalpel (ultrasound) Plasma-mediated ablation or dissection technique (coblation) Cryosurgical technique Hot methods Electrocautery Laser tonsillectomy or tonsillotomy (CO₂ or KTP) Radiofrequency
